   141	def mamba_v2_sharded_weight_loader(
   142	    shard_spec: List[Tuple[int, int, float]],
   143	    tp_size: int,
   144	    tp_rank: int,
   145	) -> LoaderFunction:
   146	    """Create a weight loader for mamba v2. This ensures that the projections 
   147	    are correctly sharded so that they can be split into x, B, C. It also 
   148	    ensures the the all the groups corresponding to a head shard is placed 
   149	    together with it.
   150	    """
   151	
   152	    def loader(param: torch.Tensor, loaded_weight: torch.Tensor) -> None:
   153	
   154	        # - track boundary of (sharded) param, and loaded_weight, respectively
   155	        boundary, loaded_boundary = 0, 0
   156	
   157	        # - iterate over the shard specs
   158	        for full_dim, extra, duplicate_groups in shard_spec:
   159	            # - full dim is the model dim (before TP).
   160	            # - extra > 0, means there is expected overall increase
   161	            #   of dimensions. This is so because of replication.
   162	            # - ratio is used map the tp_rank to the actual shard
   163	            #   rank. This is useful when there is replication of
   164	            #   groups to accompany head shards.
   165	
   166	            # - size of the loaded shard
   167	            shard_size = full_dim // tp_size
   168	
   169	            # - compute the rank into the loaded shard.
   170	            # - if there is replication, different TP shards will
   171	            #   take from the same rank.
   172	            # NOTE: currently we only support duplication
   173	            # in the case where num_groups == 1
   174	            rank = 0 if duplicate_groups else tp_rank
   175	
   176	            # - leftmost boundary index into loaded weight.
   177	            loaded_skip = rank * shard_size
   178	            loaded_start_idx = loaded_boundary + loaded_skip
   179	
   180	            # - take these many dims from the loaded weight.
   181	            take = min(shard_size, full_dim - extra - loaded_skip)
   182	
   183	            # - always shard on dim 0
   184	            # - the ignore is for a mundane mypy error as it does not
   185	            #   seem to handle slices well.
   186	            # https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/2410
   187	            param.data[
   188	                boundary:(boundary + take),  # type: ignore[misc]
   189	                ...] = loaded_weight[loaded_start_idx:(  # type: ignore[misc]
   190	                    loaded_start_idx + take)]  # type: ignore[misc]
   191	
   192	            # move indexing boundaries
   193	            boundary += shard_size
   194	            loaded_boundary += (full_dim - extra)
   195	
   196	    return loader

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Benchmark script for MambaMixer2 performance testing
"""
import torch
import time
import sys

# Simple benchmark to test tensor operations similar to those in mamba_mixer2.py
def benchmark_contiguous_call(iterations=1000):
    """Test the overhead of .contiguous() calls"""
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Simulate the operation from line 444-448
    tensor = torch.randn(1024, 2048, device=device)
    tensor = tensor.transpose(0, 1)[:1024]
    
    # Warmup
    for _ in range(10):
        result = tensor.contiguous()
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        result = tensor.contiguous()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    end = time.perf_counter()
    
    return (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms per iteration

def benchmark_zero_loop(iterations=100):
    """Test the overhead of .zero_() in a loop"""
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Simulate the operation from lines 474-476
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    ssm_state = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (16,), device=device)
    mask = torch.rand(16, device=device) > 0.5
    
    # Warmup
    for _ in range(10):
        for idx in indices[~mask]:
            ssm_state[idx].zero_()
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for idx in indices[~mask]:
            ssm_state[idx].zero_()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    end = time.perf_counter()
    
    return (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms per iteration

def benchmark_copy_loop(iterations=100):
    """Test the overhead of .copy_() in a loop"""
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Simulate the operation from line 503
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    ssm_state = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    varlen_state = torch.randn(16, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (16,), device=device)
    
    # Warmup
    for _ in range(10):
        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
            ssm_state[idx].copy_(varlen_state[i])
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
            ssm_state[idx].copy_(varlen_state[i])
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    end = time.perf_counter()
    
    return (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms per iteration

if __name__ == "__main__":

    print("MambaMixer2 Performance Benchmark")

    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    print(f"Device: {device}")

    contiguous_time = benchmark_contiguous_call()
    print(f"   Average time: {contiguous_time:.6f} ms")
    print()
    
    print("2. Testing .zero_() loop overhead...")
    zero_time = benchmark_zero_loop()
    print(f"   Average time: {zero_time:.6f} ms")
    print()
    
    print("3. Testing .copy_() loop overhead...")
    copy_time = benchmark_copy_loop()
    print(f"   Average time: {copy_time:.6f} ms")
    print()
    
    total_time = contiguous_time + zero_time + copy_time
    print("=" * 60)
    print(f"Total estimated overhead: {total_time:.6f} ms")
    print("=" * 60)

arguments.file_text:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Test script to verify the optimizations made to mamba_mixer2.py
"""
import torch
import time

def test_optimization_1_contiguous():
    """Test removal of unnecessary .contiguous() call"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 1: Removed unnecessary .contiguous() call")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    tensor = torch.randn(2048, 1024, device=device)
    
    # Simulate the operation: transpose -> slice
    result = tensor.transpose(0, 1)[:1024]
    
    # Before optimization: would call .contiguous()
    # After optimization: no .contiguous() call
    
    iterations = 1000
    
    # Test WITH contiguous (old way)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        temp = result.contiguous()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_with_contiguous = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # Test WITHOUT contiguous (new way)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        temp = result  # No contiguous call
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_without_contiguous = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time WITH .contiguous():    {time_with_contiguous:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time WITHOUT .contiguous(): {time_without_contiguous:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_with_contiguous / max(time_without_contiguous, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

def test_optimization_2_zero_loop():
    """Test optimization of .zero_() loop to advanced indexing"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 2: Loop with .zero_() -> Advanced indexing")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Setup
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    iterations = 100
    
    # OLD WAY: Loop with .zero_()
    ssm_state_old = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (8,), device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for idx in indices:
            ssm_state_old[idx].zero_()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_old = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # NEW WAY: Advanced indexing
    ssm_state_new = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        if len(indices) > 0:
            ssm_state_new[indices] = 0
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_new = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time OLD (loop + .zero_()):      {time_old:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time NEW (advanced indexing):    {time_new:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_old / max(time_new, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

def test_optimization_3_copy_loop():
    """Test optimization of .copy_() loop to advanced indexing"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 3: Loop with .copy_() -> Advanced indexing")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Setup
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    iterations = 100
    
    # OLD WAY: Loop with .copy_()
    ssm_state_old = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    varlen_state = torch.randn(8, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (8,), device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
            ssm_state_old[idx].copy_(varlen_state[i])
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_old = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # NEW WAY: Advanced indexing
    ssm_state_new = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        ssm_state_new[indices] = varlen_state
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_new = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time OLD (loop + .copy_()):      {time_old:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time NEW (advanced indexing):    {time_new:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_old / max(time_new, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

def test_optimization_4_indexing():
    """Test optimization of redundant indexing operations"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 4: Simplified indexing operations")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Setup
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    A = torch.randn(num_heads, device=device)
    
    iterations = 1000
    
    # OLD WAY: [:, None, ...][:, :, None]
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        result_old = A[:, None, ...][:, :, None].expand(-1, head_dim, state_size)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_old = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # NEW WAY: [:, None, None]
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        result_new = A[:, None, None].expand(-1, head_dim, state_size)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_new = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time OLD (redundant indexing):   {time_old:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time NEW (simplified indexing):  {time_new:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_old / max(time_new, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("MAMBA MIXER2 OPTIMIZATION TESTS")
    print("=" * 60)
    print()
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    print(f"Running on device: {device}")
    print()
    
    test_optimization_1_contiguous()
    test_optimization_2_zero_loop()
    test_optimization_3_copy_loop()
    test_optimization_4_indexing()
    
    print("=" * 60)

   146	    """Create a weight loader for mamba v2. This ensures that the projections 
   147	    are correctly sharded so that they can be split into x, B, C. It also 
   148	    ensures the the all the groups corresponding to a head shard is placed 
   149	    together with it.

   152	    def loader(param: torch.Tensor, loaded_weight: torch.Tensor) -> None:
   153	
   154	        # - track boundary of (sharded) param, and loaded_weight, respectively
   155	        boundary, loaded_boundary = 0, 0
   156	
   157	        # - iterate over the shard specs
   158	        for full_dim, extra, duplicate_groups in shard_spec:
   159	            # - full dim is the model dim (before TP).
   160	            # - extra > 0, means there is expected overall increase
   161	            #   of dimensions. This is so because of replication.
   162	            # - ratio is used map the tp_rank to the actual shard
   163	            #   rank. This is useful when there is replication of
   164	            #   groups to accompany head shards.
   165	
   166	            # - size of the loaded shard
   167	            shard_size = full_dim // tp_size
   168	
   169	            # - compute the rank into the loaded shard.
   170	            # - if there is replication, different TP shards will
   171	            #   take from the same rank.
   172	            # NOTE: currently we only support duplication
   173	            # in the case where num_groups == 1
   174	            rank = 0 if duplicate_groups else tp_rank
   175	
   176	            # - leftmost boundary index into loaded weight.
   177	            loaded_skip = rank * shard_size
   178	            loaded_start_idx = loaded_boundary + loaded_skip
   179	
   180	            # - take these many dims from the loaded weight.
   181	            take = min(shard_size, full_dim - extra - loaded_skip)
   182	
   183	            # - always shard on dim 0
   184	            # - the ignore is for a mundane mypy error as it does not
   185	            #   seem to handle slices well.

   191	
   192	            # move indexing boundaries
   193	            boundary += shard_size
   194	            loaded_boundary += (full_dim - extra)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Benchmark script for MambaMixer2 performance testing
"""
import torch
import time
import sys

# Simple benchmark to test tensor operations similar to those in mamba_mixer2.py
def benchmark_contiguous_call(iterations=1000):
    """Test the overhead of .contiguous() calls"""
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Simulate the operation from line 444-448
    tensor = torch.randn(1024, 2048, device=device)
    tensor = tensor.transpose(0, 1)[:1024]
    
    # Warmup
    for _ in range(10):
        result = tensor.contiguous()
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        result = tensor.contiguous()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    end = time.perf_counter()
    
    return (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms per iteration

def benchmark_zero_loop(iterations=100):
    """Test the overhead of .zero_() in a loop"""
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Simulate the operation from lines 474-476
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    ssm_state = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (16,), device=device)
    mask = torch.rand(16, device=device) > 0.5
    
    # Warmup
    for _ in range(10):
        for idx in indices[~mask]:
            ssm_state[idx].zero_()
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for idx in indices[~mask]:
            ssm_state[idx].zero_()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    end = time.perf_counter()
    
    return (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms per iteration

def benchmark_copy_loop(iterations=100):
    """Test the overhead of .copy_() in a loop"""
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Simulate the operation from line 503
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    ssm_state = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    varlen_state = torch.randn(16, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (16,), device=device)
    
    # Warmup
    for _ in range(10):
        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
            ssm_state[idx].copy_(varlen_state[i])
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
            ssm_state[idx].copy_(varlen_state[i])
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    end = time.perf_counter()
    
    return (end - start) / iterations * 1000  # ms per iteration

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("=" * 60)
    print("MambaMixer2 Performance Benchmark")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    print(f"Device: {device}")
    print()
    
    # Run benchmarks
    print("1. Testing .contiguous() overhead...")
    contiguous_time = benchmark_contiguous_call()
    print(f"   Average time: {contiguous_time:.6f} ms")
    print()
    
    print("2. Testing .zero_() loop overhead...")
    zero_time = benchmark_zero_loop()
    print(f"   Average time: {zero_time:.6f} ms")
    print()
    
    print("3. Testing .copy_() loop overhead...")
    copy_time = benchmark_copy_loop()
    print(f"   Average time: {copy_time:.6f} ms")
    print()
    
    total_time = contiguous_time + zero_time + copy_time
    print("=" * 60)
    print(f"Total estimated overhead: {total_time:.6f} ms")
    print("=" * 60)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Test script to verify the optimizations made to mamba_mixer2.py
"""
import torch
import time

def test_optimization_1_contiguous():
    """Test removal of unnecessary .contiguous() call"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 1: Removed unnecessary .contiguous() call")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    tensor = torch.randn(2048, 1024, device=device)
    
    # Simulate the operation: transpose -> slice
    result = tensor.transpose(0, 1)[:1024]
    
    # Before optimization: would call .contiguous()
    # After optimization: no .contiguous() call
    
    iterations = 1000
    
    # Test WITH contiguous (old way)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        temp = result.contiguous()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_with_contiguous = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # Test WITHOUT contiguous (new way)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        temp = result  # No contiguous call
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_without_contiguous = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time WITH .contiguous():    {time_with_contiguous:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time WITHOUT .contiguous(): {time_without_contiguous:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_with_contiguous / max(time_without_contiguous, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

def test_optimization_2_zero_loop():
    """Test optimization of .zero_() loop to advanced indexing"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 2: Loop with .zero_() -> Advanced indexing")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Setup
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    iterations = 100
    
    # OLD WAY: Loop with .zero_()
    ssm_state_old = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (8,), device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for idx in indices:
            ssm_state_old[idx].zero_()
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_old = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # NEW WAY: Advanced indexing
    ssm_state_new = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        if len(indices) > 0:
            ssm_state_new[indices] = 0
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_new = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time OLD (loop + .zero_()):      {time_old:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time NEW (advanced indexing):    {time_new:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_old / max(time_new, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

def test_optimization_3_copy_loop():
    """Test optimization of .copy_() loop to advanced indexing"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 3: Loop with .copy_() -> Advanced indexing")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Setup
    batch_size = 32
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    iterations = 100
    
    # OLD WAY: Loop with .copy_()
    ssm_state_old = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    varlen_state = torch.randn(8, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    indices = torch.randint(0, batch_size, (8,), device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        for i, idx in enumerate(indices):
            ssm_state_old[idx].copy_(varlen_state[i])
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_old = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # NEW WAY: Advanced indexing
    ssm_state_new = torch.randn(batch_size, num_heads, head_dim, state_size, device=device)
    
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        ssm_state_new[indices] = varlen_state
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_new = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time OLD (loop + .copy_()):      {time_old:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time NEW (advanced indexing):    {time_new:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_old / max(time_new, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

def test_optimization_4_indexing():
    """Test optimization of redundant indexing operations"""
    print("=" * 60)
    print("Optimization 4: Simplified indexing operations")
    print("=" * 60)
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    
    # Setup
    num_heads = 128
    head_dim = 64
    state_size = 128
    
    A = torch.randn(num_heads, device=device)
    
    iterations = 1000
    
    # OLD WAY: [:, None, ...][:, :, None]
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        result_old = A[:, None, ...][:, :, None].expand(-1, head_dim, state_size)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_old = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    # NEW WAY: [:, None, None]
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    start = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        result_new = A[:, None, None].expand(-1, head_dim, state_size)
    if device == 'cuda':
        torch.cuda.synchronize()
    time_new = (time.perf_counter() - start) * 1000
    
    print(f"Time OLD (redundant indexing):   {time_old:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Time NEW (simplified indexing):  {time_new:.4f} ms")
    print(f"Speedup: {time_old / max(time_new, 0.001):.2f}x")
    print()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("\n" + "=" * 60)
    print("MAMBA MIXER2 OPTIMIZATION TESTS")
    print("=" * 60)
    print()
    
    device = 'cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu'
    print(f"Running on device: {device}")
    print()
    
    test_optimization_1_contiguous()
    test_optimization_2_zero_loop()
    test_optimization_3_copy_loop()
    test_optimization_4_indexing()
    
    print("=" * 60)
    print("All optimization tests completed!")
    print("=" * 60)
